Manipulating EMF is one thing.=C2=A0 But directly storing bits on a media =
is way beyond that.=C2=A0 Bits are not stored in a continuous stream.=C2=A0=
 They are broken into bytes (little packets) that is totally controlled by =
the processor and software.=C2=A0 For Elvis to "encode directly" to the med=
ia, he would have to do what that software does to the digital signals comi=
ng in from the AtoD converter: he would have to group the bits into (for ex=
ample) 16 little herds each, decide on the specific bit interpretation sche=
me (2's complement?),=C2=A0 find space on the media, update the media's dic=
tionary of where there is free space and where there isn't, link the herds =
together with some sort of linked pointer, skip around the areas marked 'ba=
d' on the media, update things like date/time modified and size, respect an=
y kind of ownership permissions on the media, and so on.

It is much more c=
redible for the signal to be manipulated near the AtoD converter (where EMF=
 changes would have the most straighforward result) than in the digital med=
ia itself.

andma would have to have quite an understanding of digital encoding, 
     =

  =
      digital recorder, there is still an analog element (the Analog to 
  =
      Digital converter) which takes the sound pressure waves, as represent=
ed 
        by some analog electronic detection element, and converts that =
into 
        digital.=C2=A0 That way, long departed uncle Ebenezer does no=
t need to 
        do anything digital.=C2=A0 Under this scenario, if sound=
 is not being 
        heard in the room, but is being induced into the cir=
cuitry, then it 
        would be round about that AtoD converter (assuming=
 it isn't other just 
        plain old noise in the digital elements).=C2=
=A0 

Someone with 
        more electronic know-how than me might be able =
to better pinpoint the 
        area in the analog portion of that AtoD pip=
eline where it would be most 
        likely it could be influenced by, say=
, an EM field, and that would also 
        occur in a normal analog tape r=
ecorder.

top" style=3D"font: inherit;"><br>Manipulating EMF is one thing.  But =
directly storing bits on a media is way beyond that.  Bits are not sto=
red in a continuous stream.  They are broken into bytes (little packet=
s) that is totally controlled by the processor and software.  For Elvi=
s to "encode directly" to the media, he would have to do what that software=
 does to the digital signals coming in from the AtoD converter: he would ha=
ve to group the bits into (for example) 16 little herds each, decide on the=
 specific bit interpretation scheme (2's complement?),  find space on =
the media, update the media's dictionary of where there is free space and w=
here there isn't, link the herds together with some sort of linked pointer,=
 skip around the areas marked 'bad' on the media, update things like date/t=
ime modified and size, respect any kind of ownership permissions on the med=
ia,
 and so on.<br><br>It is much more credible for the signal to be manipu=
lated near the AtoD converter (where EMF changes would have the most straig=
hforward result) than in the digital media itself.<br><br>--- On <b>Wed, 5/=
20/09, April Abercrombie <i><april@...></i><=
